name: Rheum
Relationship: Complementary: MAG. CARB.Antidotes: CAMPH.; CHAM.Compare: MAG. PHOS.; HEP.; POD.; CHAM.; IPEC.

Head: Cool sweat on the face, especially about mouth and nose
Sweat on hairy scalp; constant and profuse
Stomach: Desire for various kinds of food, but soon tires of all
Mind: Impatient and vehement; desires many things and cries
Abdomen: Wind seems to rise up to chest
Rectum: Colicky, even ineffectual urging to evacuate altered faecal stools
Before stool, unsuccessful urging to urinate
Stools smell sour, pasty, with shivering and tenesmus, and burning in anus

details: Of frequent use in children with sour diarrhoea; difficult dentition. WHOLE CHILD SMELLS SOUR.
